py_sim.sim.generic_sim module¶

generic_sim.py: Provides general data structures for the simulation

Stores data after update

update() → None¶

Calls all of the update functions

update_plot() → None¶

Plot the current values and state. Should be done with lock to avoid simultaneous access of state.

class py_sim.sim.generic_sim.SimParameters(initial_state: StateType)¶

Bases: Generic[StateType]

Contains a fixed set of parameters that do not change throughout

the simulation, but are needed for simulation execution

initial_state¶

State at the beginning of the simulation

Type:

StateType

sim_update_period¶

Period for successive calls to updating the simulation variables

Type:

float

sim_plot_period¶

Period for which the plotting should occur

Type:

float

sim_step¶

Simulation time step (seconds)

Type:

float

t0¶

The initial time of the simulation

Type:

float

tf¶

Final time of the simulation

Type:

float

async py_sim.sim.generic_sim.continuous_plotting(sim: Sim[StateType]) → None¶

Plot the data at a certain rate

async py_sim.sim.generic_sim.run_simulation(sim: Sim[StateType]) → None¶

Run the simulation

py_sim.sim.generic_sim.start_sim(sim: Sim[StateType]) → None¶

Starts the simulation and the plotting of a simple sequential simulator

Parameters:

sim – The simulation to be run
